intro: Chrysophyllum heteromerum, commonly known as the African cherry or yellow cherries, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, containing a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential economic importance, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
